meanings.definition: To grant a license or right to use a brand name or business model in exchange for payment.
meanings.sent1: The company francised their popular restaurant concept to entrepreneurs.
meanings.sent2: She francised her bakery and now has multiple locations.
meanings.sent3: The idea of francising a lemonade stand seemed silly at first, but it turned out to be a profitable venture.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to francise her clothing store was like planting seeds of success.
meanings.sent5: The process of francising a business requires careful planning and legal agreements.

meanings.sent1: He francised his small business to expand its reach.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to francise their operations to reach more customers.
meanings.sent3: The toy store was francised into a chain of stores, much to the delight of kids everywhere.
meanings.sent4: Her dream of francising her art studio finally became a reality.
meanings.sent5: The decision to francise the gym was a strategic move to attract new members.

meanings.sent1: The francised restaurant was bustling with customers.
meanings.sent2: She was excited to visit the francised coffee shop in the new mall.
meanings.sent3: The francised car dealership offered great deals on vehicles.
meanings.sent4: The francised hotel provided top-notch service to its guests.
meanings.sent5: The francised gym had state-of-the-art equipment for its members.
